intro: Tapeinosperma netor, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, kidney-shaped berries. Its fruits are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical features of Tapeinosperma netor make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
